intro: Jurinea cataonica subsp. mardinensis, commonly known as the Mardin sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of southeastern Turkey, particularly around the Mardin area. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
